description: From Middle English forleven; equivalent to for- +â€Ž leave. Compare Old High German firleiban.

verbs.description: forleave (third-person singular simple present forleaves, present participle forleaving, simple past and past participle forleft or forlaft)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive, obsolete) To depart from (someone); leave (someone) behind; abandon; forsake; desert; give up; relinquish.
examples: In a lityll I forlefte the.
